Taylor Swift Tak Gelar Tur 'Lover' demi Ibunda
04 Nov 2019, 20:53 by , https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Taylor Swift mengisyaratkan tak menggelar tur album 'Lover' demi keluarga. (dok. YouTube/TaylorSwift)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia -- Di awal tahun 2019, Taylor Swift mengaku sama sekali tak merencanakan tur untuk promo album Lover. Ia hanya mengumumkan serangkaian konser yang merupakan bagian dari festival internasional pada 2020.Dalam wawancara bersama Zane Lowe di Radio Beats 1, Taylor mengungkapkan bahwa sang ibu menjadi alasan utamanya melakukan 'perubahan' dalam hidup. Ibu Taylor saat ini diketahui tengah berjuang melawan kanker."Perubahan tidak hanya terjadi di karier, tetapi dalam hidup saya. Ada beberapa hal intens sedang terjadi dalam keluarga saya," katanya.Ia menambahkan, "Saya tidak bisa menjalani tur panjang dan tidak bisa pulang ke rumah jika kondisi mengharuskannya. Saya punya prioritas, dan tur tidak termasuk di dalamnya, dan penggemar sangat menghormati [keputusan] itu."Taylor mengakui, ia harus mengambil keputusan berdasarkan prioritas, hal terpenting dalam hidupnya."Ketika ada tanda tanya di hidup saya dan hal-hal yang sangat penting bagi saya dan keluarga, saya harus punya 'ruang bernapas' di antara jadwal tur dan saya kira mereka memahami hal itu," ujarnya.Ibu Taylor, Andrea Gardner Swift, didiagnosis menderita kanker pada 2015. Beberapa bulan lalu, Taylor berkata kepada Elle Magazine bahwa kanker itu telah kembali ke tubuh sang ibu. "Kedua orang tua saya menderita kanker, dan ibu saya sekarang berjuang lagi melawannya. Kanker ibuku adalah masalah nyata. Dulu saya selalu gelisah tentang naik turun kehidupan sehari-hari. [Sekarang] saya menyerahkan segala kekhawatiran, stres, dan doa saya untuk masalah yang benar-benar nyata," kata Taylor.Taylor Swift menulis lagu 'Soon You'll Get Better' yang ia dedikasikan untuk perjuangan sang ibu. Lagu itu dimuat dalam album terbaru Lover, yang terjual tiga juta unit dalam minggu pertama rilis. (daf/rea)

Taylor Swift Not Holds 'Lover' Tour for Mother
04 Nov 2019, 20:53 by, https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Taylor Swift hinted not to tour the album 'Lover' for the sake of the family. (doc. YouTube / TaylorSwift)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia - In early 2019, Taylor Swift claimed that he had no plans to tour for the promo album Lover. He only announced a series of concerts that were part of an international festival in 2020. In an interview with Zane Lowe on Radio Beats 1, Taylor revealed that her mother was the main reason for making a 'change' in life. Taylor's mother is currently known to be battling cancer. "Change has not only happened in my career, but in my life. There are some intense things happening in my family," he said. He added, "I can't go on a long tour and can't go home "I have a priority, and the tour is not included, and fans really respect that [decision]." Taylor admitted, he had to make decisions based on priorities, the most important thing in his life. "When there was a question mark in my life. and things that are very important for me and my family, I need to have a 'breathing room' between tour dates and I think they understand that, "he said. Taylor's mother, Andrea Gardner Swift, was diagnosed with cancer in 2015. A few months ago Taylor said to Elle Magazine that the cancer had returned to the mother's body. "Both my parents have cancer, and my mother is now fighting again. My mother's cancer is a real problem. I used to be nervous about the ups and downs of daily life. [Now] I give up all my worries, stress, and prayers for problems that really real, "Taylor said. Taylor Swift wrote the song 'Soon You'll Get Better' which she dedicated to her mother's struggle. The song was featured in Lover's latest album, which sold three million units in its first week of release. (daf / rea)
